component.title: MSV
component.description: Validates the payload of a message using the MSV Library.
component.label: validation

resourceResolverFactory.label: advanced
resourceResolverFactory.description: To use a custom LSResourceResolver which depends on a dynamic endpoint resource URI

resolvePropertyPlaceholders.label: advanced
resolvePropertyPlaceholders.description: Whether the component should resolve property placeholders on itself when starting. Only properties which are of String type can use property placeholders.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

resourceUri.description: URL to a local resource on the classpath,or a reference to lookup a bean in the Registry, or a full URL to a remote resource or resource on the file system which contains the XSD to validate against.

failOnNullBody.description: Whether to fail if no body exists.

failOnNullHeader.description: Whether to fail if no header exists when validating against a header.

headerName.description: To validate against a header instead of the message body.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

errorHandler.label: advanced
errorHandler.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.processor.validation.ValidatorErrorHandler. The default error handler captures the errors and throws an exception.

resourceResolver.label: advanced
resourceResolver.description: To use a custom LSResourceResolver. See also setResourceResolverFactory(ValidatorResourceResolverFactory)

resourceResolverFactory.label: advanced
resourceResolverFactory.description: For creating a resource resolver which depends on the endpoint resource URI. Must not be used in combination with method setResourceResolver(LSResourceResolver). If not set then DefaultValidatorResourceResolverFactory is used

schemaLanguage.label: advanced
schemaLanguage.description: Configures the W3C XML Schema Namespace URI.

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

useSharedSchema.label: advanced
useSharedSchema.description: Whether the Schema instance should be shared or not. This option is introduced to work around a JDK 1.6.x bug. Xerces should not have this issue.
